lead_paragraph: The death of Alan Kurdi, 2, which focused the world on refugees, was just one chapter of a sprawling family’s story in its desperate attempts to escape Syria and find a new home.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Turkey and Beirut, Lebanon; Karam Shoumali from Istanbul; Amro Refai from Germany; Tim Arango from Baghdad; Ben Hubbard from Kobani, Syria; and Kamil Kakol from Erbil, Iraq.

headline.print_headline: Family’s Tragedy Goes Beyond One Boy
headline.main: Remembering Alan Kurdi: Syrian Family’s Tragedy Goes Beyond Image of Boy on Beach

snippet: The death of Alan Kurdi, 2, which focused the world on refugees, was just one chapter of a sprawling family’s story in its desperate attempts to escape Syria and find a new home....
abstract: Interviews with 20 relatives of Aylan Kurdi, toddler whose dead body on beach in Turkey was later captured in photograph that shocked world, reveal how Syrian conflict has affected his family and forced them all to try to flee country; family are ethnically Kurds, yet before conflict they had identified mainly as Syrian.
